methodology: External validation via ClinicalTrials.gov and PubMed

tier_1_high_priority.description: Strong model signal + moderate external evidence = potential novel repurposing

candidates.rationale: mTOR inhibitor. mTOR pathway implicated in psoriasis pathogenesis. Could be alternative to biologics.
next_steps: Literature deep dive on mTOR in psoriasis

candidates.rationale: Antiplatelet agent. Emerging evidence for platelet-immune system crosstalk in RA.
next_steps: Assess safety profile for chronic use

candidates.rationale: mTOR inhibitor already used in transplant. Shares mechanism with sirolimus.
next_steps: Check for synergy with existing DMARDs

candidates.rationale: Well-known repurposing candidate. Multiple epidemiological studies show reduced cancer risk in diabetics on metformin.
next_steps: This is already being actively investigated - review trial status

candidates.rationale: Cardiac glycoside with 8 trials and 45 publications. Unexpected metabolic connection.
next_steps: Deep dive on digoxin-glucose metabolism link

tier_2_emerging.description: Novel predictions with some literature support

candidates.rationale: Anti-EGFR mAb. EGFR overexpressed in gastric cancer. Extension of CRC indication.
PARP inhibitor. Already approved for BRCA+ breast cancer - model capturing this.
Alkylating agent used in conditioning. Some use in myeloma protocols.

tier_3_novel_unvalidated.description: High model scores with minimal external evidence - truly novel or spurious

candidates.note: Top model prediction but no trials/pubs. Mechanism unclear - needs investigation.
Topoisomerase II inhibitor. Why RA? Possible anti-proliferative effect on synoviocytes?

key_findings: 57% of top predictions have strong external evidence - model is learning real patterns
10% have moderate evidence - best repurposing candidates for follow-up
Model correctly identifies approved indications (Cetuximab/CRC, Bevacizumab/CRC, etc.)
mTOR inhibitors (Sirolimus, Everolimus) show consistent signal for autoimmune diseases
Digoxin for T2D is unexpected but has 8 trials - warrants investigation
